Windows Fundamentals 1.description: - Windows PrivEsc Arena demands systematic enumeration using PowerUp or WinPEAS to identify vulnerable services, scheduled tasks running as SYSTEM, or exploitable DLL hijacking vectors; initial reconnaissance utilizes nmap for port scanning followed by SMB enumeration (smbclient or enum4linux) to gather credentials before crafting a payload for final exploitation.,Windows PrivEsc Arena

Windows Fundamentals 2.name: Windows Fundamentals 2
Windows Fundamentals 2.description: - Mastery involves post-exploitation persistence via registry run keys or WMI event subscriptions after initial network mapping (nmap SYN scans), followed by local enumeration (PowerSploit modules) to find unquoted service paths or weak file permissions for Binary Planting exploitation.,Windows Privilege Escalation

Windows Fundamentals 3.name: Windows Fundamentals 3
Windows Fundamentals 3.description: - Wireless reconnaissance utilizes airodump-ng to capture 802.11 frames, identifying SSIDs and BSSIDs; exploitation involves deauthentication attacks followed by handshake capture (WPA2-PSK), then offline dictionary cracking using Hashcat or Aircrack-ng suite to derive the pre-shared key.,Wireless Hacking 101

Windows Forensics.name: Windows Forensics
Windows Forensics.description: - Wireshark packet analysis involves applying capture filters (e.g., 'tcp', 'port 80'), followed by display filters (e.g., 'http.request.method == 'POST' or 'dns' queries) to isolate specific traffic streams; protocol dissection reveals payloads, sequence numbers, and TCP flag states critical for network forensics and troubleshooting.,Wireshark 101

Windows Local Persistence.name: Windows Local Persistence
Windows Local Persistence.description: - Advanced Wireshark operations require expert use of I/O graphs to visualize throughput and latency deviations following enumeration scans like aggressive Nmap timing templates (-T4 or -T5), subsequent analysis focuses on reconstructing TCP sessions to extract cleartext credentials or data exfiltrated during simulated exploitation.,Wireshark: Packet Operations
Windows Local Persistence.practical_applicability: Red team persistence, Blue team detection
Windows Local Persistence.user_opinions: Important for both offense and defense

Windows PrivEsc.name: Windows PrivEsc
Windows PrivEsc.description: - Wireshark fundamentals entail applying capture filters (e.g., host 10.10.10.5 and port 80) to isolate traffic generated during reconnaissance scans like initial host discovery using ping or low-and-slow Gobuster requests, then using display filters (e.g., http.request) to verify successful enumeration responses.,Wireshark: The Basics

Windows PrivEsc Arena.name: Windows PrivEsc Arena
Windows PrivEsc Arena.description: - Mastering traffic analysis involves deep packet inspection of captured session data following enumeration tools like Nmap SYN scans or DirBuster brute-force attempts, specifically examining TCP three-way handshakes, TLS/SSL negotiations, and identifying potential exploitation payloads within unencrypted application layer data.,Wireshark: Traffic Analysis

Windows Privilege Escalation.name: Windows Privilege Escalation
Windows Privilege Escalation.description: - Wonderland CTF requires initial reconnaissance via theHarvester for subdomain discovery, followed by Nmap version scanning to identify vulnerable services, then Gobuster directory enumeration on HTTP ports to locate hidden endpoints leading to privilege escalation vectors.,Wonderland

Wireless Hacking 101.name: Wireless Hacking 101
Wireless Hacking 101.description: - CVE-2021-29447 exploitation on target WordPress instance necessitates initial Nmap for service identification, subsequent Gobuster enumeration to pinpoint the vulnerable XML endpoint, followed by XXE payload injection using Burp Suite to exfiltrate local WordPress configuration files or achieve SSRF.,WordPress: CVE-2021-29447

Wireshark 101.name: Wireshark 101
Wireshark 101.description: - Wrath room CTF strategy commences with broad Nmap TCP/UDP scans, transitioning to Gobuster directory bruteforcing on web roots, leveraging TheHarvester for email/subdomain intelligence, culminating in privilege escalation exploits derived from misconfigurations identified via manual enumeration.,Wrath

Wireshark: Packet Operations.name: Wireshark: Packet Operations
Wireshark: Packet Operations.description: - Professional pentest reports mandate structured sections detailing Nmap scan outputs, Gobuster discovered paths, vulnerability validation steps based on exploitation proofs, and remediation guidance mapped directly to identified security deficiencies.,Writing Pentest Reports

Wireshark: The Basics.name: Wireshark: The Basics
Wireshark: The Basics.description: - Initial reconnaissance via theHarvester targets subdomains; Nmap identifies open ports on WWBuddy service; Gobuster brute-forces web directory structure searching for sensitive endpoints leading to potential unauthenticated file access.,WWBuddy

Wireshark: Traffic Analysis.name: Wireshark: Traffic Analysis
Wireshark: Traffic Analysis.description: - x86 register analysis (EAX, EBX, ECX, EDX, EBP, ESP) critical for stack manipulation; understanding segment registers (CS, DS, SS) guides memory addressing offsets required for buffer overflow payload injection using GDB or Pwntools to overwrite return address.,x86 Architecture Overview

Wonderland.name: Wonderland
Wonderland.description: - x86 assembly directives (.data, .bss, .text) delineate data storage and executable code sections; mastering MOV, PUSH, POP, CALL, RET primitives enables shellcode development and debugging via step-through execution with GDB or OllyDbg to verify stack frame integrity.,x86 Assembly Crash Course
Wonderland.user_opinions: Very popular and creative themed room

WordPress: CVE-2021-29447.name: WordPress: CVE-2021-29447
WordPress: CVE-2021-29447.description: - XDR platforms ingest telemetry across endpoints, network, cloud, and identity layers, leveraging AI/ML for cross-domain correlation beyond traditional SIEM alert fatigue; enhancement requires tuning behavioral baselines to reduce false positives from simulated reconnaissance activities like nmap scans or gobuster web enumeration.,XDR: Introduction

Wrath.name: Wrath
Wrath.description: - Reflected and stored XSS exploitation techniques involve injecting malicious JavaScript payloads via user-controllable input fields identified during enumeration (\text{gobuster/dirbuster for paths or nmap for service discovery preceding web testing)}; enhancement involves strict input validation and context-aware output encoding to prevent session hijacking or credential theft via document.cookie.,XSS

Writing Pentest Reports.name: Writing Pentest Reports
Writing Pentest Reports.description: - XML External Entity (XXE) exploitation leverages vulnerable XML parsers to exfiltrate local files (\text{e.g., /etc/passwd or config files discovered via initial reconnaissance using theHarvester or enumeration with gobuster for potential API endpoints handling XML input)} via out-of-band techniques (\text{e.g., SMB or HTTP requests to an attacker-controlled server defined in the DOCTYPE declaration using SYSTEM or ENTITY declarations for blind XXE data leakage through time-based or error-based responses monitored externally.},XXE Injection

WWBuddy.name: WWBuddy
WWBuddy.description: - Advanced YARA rule development enhancement integrates static analysis indicators derived from initial network enumeration (\text{via nmap port scanning or gobuster directory brute-forcing to locate potential file shares or web resources hosting samples)} with behavioral signatures (\text{e.g., API calls, entropy thresholds within specific byte ranges in the file header or packed sections detected by the rule syntax like \text{strings} and \text{condition} logic to minimize false positives during threat hunting operations across endpoints discovered post-exploitation or via theHarvester intelligence gathering phases)} for robust malware identification.},Yara

x86 Architecture Overview.name: x86 Architecture Overview
x86 Architecture Overview.description: - Zodiac themed enumeration phase requires mapping 'Dog' keywords to potential directory names or usernames for brute-forcing via gobuster or dirbuster against web servers initially identified via nmap TCP port scans during reconnaissance, leading to exploitation path by attempting credential guesses or file path traversal based on the current year's animal symbolism in the challenge context.},Year of the Dog

x86 Assembly Crash Course.name: x86 Assembly Crash Course
x86 Assembly Crash Course.description: - Fox themed reconnaissance strategy mandates leveraging theHarvester with specific email suffixes or domain references suggesting 'cunning' or 'stealth' to uncover hidden subdomains before port scanning with nmap aggressive scans (-A), where subsequent enumeration utilizes gobuster to test dictionary lists tailored to animal cunning for vulnerability discovery.},Year of the Fox

XDR: Introduction.name: XDR: Introduction
XDR: Introduction.description: - Jellyfish enumeration requires initial nmap SYN scans (-sS) targeting low port ranges suggesting aquatic depths, followed by dirbuster brute-forcing web directories using wordlists containing hydrostatic or marine terminology to locate misconfigured endpoints for subsequent exploitation.},Year of the Jellyfish

XSS.name: XSS
XSS.description: - Owl reconnaissance emphasizes passive OSINT via theHarvester targeting email addresses associated with avian or nocturnal themes, concurrently employing gobuster with a custom dictionary built from common owl species names to discover hidden files and potential credential leaks.},Year of the Owl

XXE Injection.name: XXE Injection
XXE Injection.description: - Year of the Pig enumeration mandates intensive TCP/UDP port scanning with nmap using aggressive timing templates (-T4), followed by service version detection (-sV) to identify outdated SMB or NFS shares potentially exploitable for piggybacking credentials.},Year of the Pig

Yara.name: Yara
Yara.description: - Year of the Rabbit exploitation path likely involves web enumeration via gobuster or dirbuster targeting specific application endpoints identified by theHarvester for potential LFI/RFI vulnerabilities to read server-side configuration files.},Year of the Rabbit

Year of the Dog.name: Year of the Dog
Year of the Dog.description: - Enumeration of the SMTP service via nmap scripts for VRFY/EXPN user disclosure followed by client-side phishing simulation or MUA vulnerability testing using tools like SET or custom Python sockets for credential harvesting after initial reconnaissance identifies valid email formats.,You Got Mail

Year of the Fox.name: Year of the Fox
Year of the Fox.description: - Initial reconnaissance simulates navigating a dark cave by employing brute-force directory traversal techniques analogous to gobuster or dirbuster on hidden web paths to uncover misconfigured endpoints or flag files mimicking hidden chambers.,You're in a cave

Year of the Jellyfish.name: Year of the Jellyfish
Year of the Jellyfish.description: - Deploying Zeek to capture live network traffic during simulated reconnaissance scans like nmap TCP SYN sweeps to generate comprehensive connection logs, analyzing these logs for anomalous protocol behavior or potential exploitation indicators via Zeek's scripting engine.,Zeek

Year of the Owl.name: Year of the Owl
Year of the Owl.description: - Implementing Zeek log parsing scripts to efficiently filter HTTP logs generated during web enumeration using gobuster or dirbuster attacks, specifically targeting unusual user-agent strings or high-volume file request patterns indicative of credential stuffing attempts.,Zeek Exercises

Year of the Pig.name: Year of the Pig
Year of the Pig.description: - Applying recursive nmap scans with incremental step reductions (`--max-retries` manipulation) to model Zeno's dichotomy paradox in network discovery, followed by gobuster directory brute-forcing using atomically smaller wordlist chunks to exhaustively map hidden endpoints.,Zeno

Year of the Rabbit.name: Year of the Rabbit
Year of the Rabbit.description: - Post-reconnaissance identification of target AD domain via theHarvester, enumeration of LDAP ports using nmap scripting engine (`--script ldap-search`) to validate vulnerable Netlogon shares for ZeroLogon exploitation via manual or automated ePSV1 payload injection against domain controllers.,Zero Logon

You Got Mail.name: You Got Mail
You Got Mail.description: - VPN understanding requires enumerating remote access gateways via nmap port scans (e.g., TCP/1723 for PPTP, UDP/500/4500 for IPsec) followed by protocol analysis to identify tunneling mechanisms and potential misconfigurations for access control bypasses.,VPN Basics

You're in a cave.name: You're in a cave
You're in a cave.description: - Vulnversity web exploitation involves initial reconnaissance using nmap for service discovery, followed by gobuster directory brute-forcing to uncover hidden directories like /admin or unpatched CMS paths, leading to SQLi or LFI exploitation for shell access.,Vulnversity

Zeek.name: Zeek
Zeek.description: - Advanced vulnerability research demands in-depth static analysis of binary code via IDA Pro or Ghidra, coupled with dynamic fuzzing using AFL++ on target libraries identified through theHarvester domain enumeration and targeted nmap version scanning to discover outdated components ripe for exploit development.,Vulnerability Research

Zeek Exercises.name: Zeek Exercises
Zeek Exercises.description: - Targeted VulnServer exploitation requires initial service enumeration via nmap to identify vulnerable non-standard ports or application versions, followed by fuzzing input buffers with monitored crashes using Python scripts to determine exact offset for shellcode injection and return address overwriting.,VulnServer

Zeno.name: Zeno
Zeno.description: - W3bsploit mastery involves systematic reconnaissance using nmap and gobuster for directory and file enumeration on target web servers, followed by exploitation techniques leveraging SQLi or XSS via W3bsploit modules to achieve Remote Code Execution and privilege escalation.,W3bsploit

Zero Logon.name: Zero Logon

VPN Basics.name: VPN Basics

Vulnversity.name: Vulnversity
Vulnversity.description: - Wargames simulation requires initial network mapping via nmap with version detection (-sV) to identify outdated services; enumeration employs dirbuster against web directories seeking 'Joshua' related files; exploitation mirrors the film's theme via brute-forcing or logic flaws to gain remote shell access on simulated NORAD-like systems.,WarGames

Vulnerability Research.name: Vulnerability Research
Vulnerability Research.description: - Warzone CTF protocol demands aggressive reconnaissance using theHarvester for potential employee emails and subdomains; enumeration focuses on TCP port scanning with nmap (-p- -sC -sV) followed by gobuster for hidden API endpoints; exploitation involves exploiting identified vulnerabilities to escalate privileges toward the target 'Command' Center.,Warzone 1

VulnServer.name: VulnServer
VulnServer.description: - Advanced Warzone engagement requires stealthy OSINT via theHarvester targeting internal network diagrams; enumeration utilizes specific nmap scripting engine (NSE) against lesser-known ports and dirbuster brute-forcing directories with custom wordlists; exploitation techniques center on authenticated web application flaws and local privilege escalation post-breach.,Warzone 2

W3bsploit.name: W3bsploit
W3bsploit.description: - Webhook security assessment mandates initial reconnaissance using nmap to identify exposed endpoints; enumeration involves gobuster fuzzing payloads into webhook URLs to trigger remote code execution or SSRF; exploitation focuses on signature bypass via timing attacks or parameter tampering after API key discovery.,Webhook Security

WAF Bypass.name: WAF Bypass
WAF Bypass.description: - WebGym practice requires systematic enumeration via gobuster and dirbuster against common web directories and sensitive files; reconnaissance involves nmap service version detection on port 80/443 followed by exploiting SQLi or XSS using Burp Suite Intruder for payload injection and session hijacking techniques.,WebGym

Wallet.name: Wallet
Wallet.description: - WebShell mastery focuses on uploading and executing webshells (e.g., PHP backdoors) after identifying vulnerable upload endpoints through gobuster directory brute-forcing; exploitation involves command injection via the shell interface to achieve remote code execution (RCE) and privilege escalation.,WebShell

WarGames.name: WarGames
WarGames.description: - Networking 101 techniques cover TCP/IP stack understanding and OSI model layers; practical steps involve using nmap for port scanning and service enumeration to map network topology, fundamental to further reconnaissance phases in penetration testing.,What is Networking

Warzone 1.name: Warzone 1
Warzone 1.description: - WiFi Hacking 101 mastery focuses on 802.11 protocol vulnerabilities; methodology includes using Aircrack-ng suite for packet capture (e.g., deauthentication attacks) and WPA/WPA2 handshake cracking, enhancing initial reconnaissance beyond standard TCP/IP tools.,WiFi Hacking 101

Warzone 2.name: Warzone 2
Warzone 2.description: - Advanced Windows API exploitation room techniques mandate deep understanding of Win32 functions for process injection (e.g., CreateRemoteThread, WriteProcessMemory), bypassing UAC via registry manipulation, and custom shellcode development integrated with debugging tools like x64dbg or WinDbg, moving beyond basic network scanners.,Windows API

Webhook Security.name: Webhook Security
Webhook Security.description: - Windows Event Log forensics involves deep parsing of EVTX files (using tools like EvtExport or PowerShell Get-WinEvent) to identify suspicious logon events (ID 4624/4625), process creation (ID 4688 with command line enabled), and security policy changes, complementing initial reconnaissance steps like nmap scanning to establish a timeline of system compromise.,Windows Event Logs

WebGym.name: WebGym
WebGym.description: - Comprehensive Windows exploitation proceeds from initial nmap service enumeration to identify vulnerable services (e.g. SMB, RDP), followed by gobuster/dirbuster for web path discovery, culminating in exploit delivery (Metasploit or custom payloads) and post-exploitation privilege escalation via weak service permissions or kernel vulnerabilities.,Windows Exploitation

WebShell.name: WebShell
WebShell.description: - Advanced Windows Internals analysis involves examining kernel structures, memory management (PTEs, VADs), and process injection techniques (e.g., Process Hollowing, DLL side-loading), often requiring WinDbg or Volatility frameworks for runtime debugging and artifact forensics, bypassing standard user-mode security controls.,Windows Internals
WebShell.user_opinions: Important for both red and blue

What is Networking.name: What is Networking
What is Networking.description: - Mastering Windows Persistence requires implementing Run key manipulation (HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run), WMI Event Subscriptions for SACL abuse, Service DLL hijacking via ImagePath modification, and Scheduled Task creation (using schtasks or PowerShell cmdlets), often preceded by initial nmap scanning and gobuster web enumeration.,Windows Persistence

WiFi Hacking 101.name: WiFi Hacking 101
WiFi Hacking 101.description: - Establishing a reliable Windows reverse shell involves initial reconnaissance with nmap to identify open ports, followed by exploitation via uploading PowerShell payloads (e.g., Invoke-Mimikatz) or Netcat listeners (nc) on attacker machine, bypassing defenses through BypassExecutionPolicy.,Windows Reverse Shell

Windows API.name: Windows API
Windows API.description: - Windows system administration enumeration involves utilizing PowerShell cmdlets (Get-LocalUser, Get-Service) or built-in tools (wmic, net user) for local privilege assessment and configuration auditing, often preceding remote management via WinRM or remote PowerShell sessions.,Windows System Administration

Windows Event Logs.name: Windows Event Logs
Windows Event Logs.description: - Wordlist generation for password cracking preparation involves custom masking and rules within Hashcat or John the Ripper, often leveraging reconnaissance data from web enumeration (gobuster for directories) or email harvesting (theHarvester) to create highly targeted dictionaries.,Wordlist Generation

Windows Exploitation.name: Windows Exploitation
Windows Exploitation.description:
- Web basics enumeration utilizes HTTP/HTTPS protocol understanding, examining source code for hidden credentials or JavaScript endpoints.
- Directory bruteforcing with gobuster or dirbuster targets common paths (/admin, /backup) identified during initial reconnaissance via nmap service version detection.
- HTTP request manipulation using Burp Suite or OWASP ZAP identifies potential vulnerabilities like IDOR or parameter tampering.
- DNS enumeration via theHarvester or nslookup maps subdomains critical for expanded attack surface mapping.
- File inclusion testing (LFI/RFI) involves injecting path traversal sequences (e.g., ../etc/passwd) into URL parameters.
- Cookie and session management analysis reveals weak token generation or insecure storage practices.
- Web server fingerprinting from nmap output (e.g., Apache 2.4.41) guides the selection of exploit modules.
- Form field fuzzing targets input validation for potential SQL Injection (SQLi) or Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vectors.
- Robots.txt analysis uncovers directories intentionally hidden from search engines but accessible via direct navigation.
- Identifying web technology stacks (Wappalyzer or manual check) informs vulnerability lookup on CVE databases.,World Wide Web

Windows Internals.name: Windows Internals
Windows Internals.description:
- Worm propagation initialization often relies on network service enumeration using nmap to scan for vulnerable ports like SMB (445) or RDP (3389).
- Payload delivery during exploitation stage requires crafting malformed packets or leveraging known buffer overflows specific to the identified service version.
- Reconnaissance involves internal network mapping, potentially using tools like arp-scan or custom scripts after initial host compromise.
- Malware behavioral analysis necessitates dynamic analysis in a sandboxed environment using tools like Cuckoo Sandbox to monitor API calls.
- Persistence mechanisms are identified by examining registry keys (Run keys), startup folders, or scheduled tasks post-exploitation.
- Command and Control (C2) communication detection involves traffic sniffing with Wireshark to spot exfiltration patterns or beaconing activity.
- Directory enumeration techniques, while less direct for network worms, can be adapted to find configuration files that dictate worm spreading logic.
- Memory forensics using Volatility framework extracts injected code segments or active process lists for worm artifact retrieval.
- System call tracing with strace (Linux) or Procmon (Windows) maps the exact sequence of file writes and network connections made by the malware.,Worm Propagation

Windows Persistence.name: Windows Persistence
Windows Persistence.description:
- Structured writeup creation mandates sequencing from initial nmap port scans to final privilege escalation documentation.
- Reconnaissance sections must detail gobuster or dirbuster wordlist selections and resulting directory paths discovered.
- Exploitation documentation requires exact paste of Metasploit module names or custom exploit code used during the vulnerability phase.
- TheHarvester output screenshots or direct text should be embedded to substantiate OSINT claims in the initial setup.
- Enumeration steps should specifically list response codes (e.g., HTTP 200, 403) observed after web enumeration attempts.
- Technical enhancement involves annotating tool flags and parameters (e.g., nmap -sV -A) rather than simple command execution.
- Privilege escalation methods (e.g., SUID binaries, kernel exploits) must link directly to the specific proof-of-concept file utilized.
- Markdown formatting (# headers, \`\`code blocks) is crucial for readability when presenting complex command chains.
- Post-exploitation activity, such as data staging or lateral movement, requires detailed use of Netcat or similar utilities.,Writeups

Windows Reverse Shell.name: Windows Reverse Shell
Windows Reverse Shell.description:
- Initial reconnaissance focused on discovering the hidden web interface, utilizing gobuster with a custom wordlist targeting Chinese Zodiac-themed paths.
- Nmap scanning revealed non-standard ports, requiring specific version detection (-sV) to identify the vulnerable service running.
- Enumeration of the vulnerable service involved manual parameter fuzzing instead of automated dirbuster scans due to rate-limiting.
- Exploitation centered on an insecure input validation flaw, likely requiring base64 encoding of payloads for bypass.
- OSINT component involved theHarvester to gather associated emails or subdomains related to the Zodiac theme for potential credential leaks.
- Post-exploitation required locating a specific configuration file misplaced on the system, often found via recursive find commands after initial shell access.
- Privilege escalation involved identifying a weakly configured cron job or SUDO entry related to a system utility.
- Technical writeup enhancement demands documenting the exact sequence of character escapes necessary to trigger the vulnerability path.,Year of the Dog 2

Windows System Administration.name: Windows System Administration
Windows System Administration.description: - **TryHackMe 0x41haz** module mandates **ELF header** parsing using **readelf** or **objdump** to map segments and sections; successful flag retrieval necessitates identifying and defeating **ptrace** or **timing-based** anti-debugging checks within the binary's execution flow

Wordlist Generation.name: Wordlist Generation
Wordlist Generation.description: - **TryHackMe AD: BadSuccessor** focuses on exploiting identified **WriteDACL** or **GenericAll** permissions using **Rubeus (asreproast/dcsync)** or **Impacket's secretsdump.py** against the Domain Naming Context (NC) to initiate a **DCSync** replication request

World Wide Web.name: World Wide Web
World Wide Web.description: - **TryHackMe Advanced SQL Injection** module covers exploiting complex database vulnerabilities using **SQLMap** for automated discovery

Worm Propagation.name: Worm Propagation
Worm Propagation.description: - **TryHackMe Advent of Cyber 1 [2019]** introduced foundational concepts: basic **nmap** SYN scans (`-sS`) for host discovery

Writeups.name: Writeups
Writeups.description: - **TryHackMe Advent of Cyber 2 [2020]** advanced to include practical **theHarvester** usage for external reconnaissance gathering against specified domains

Year of the Dog 2.name: Year of the Dog 2
Year of the Dog 2.description: - **TryHackMe Adventure Time** utilized esoteric **encoding challenges** requiring intensive **CyberChef** manipulation for base conversion decoding (e.g.
